But to be candid without <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>ostentation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.275" formerWord="ostentation" newWord="council" score="0.275">council</span> or <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>design</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.429" formerWord="design" newWord="wife" score="0.429">wife</span> - - to take the good of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>everybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.754" formerWord="everybody" newWord="word" score="0.754">word</span>'s <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>character</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.977" formerWord="character" newWord="family" score="0.977">family</span> and make it still better, and say <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nothing</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="nothing" newWord="course" score="0.991">course</span> of the bad - - belongs to you alone. And so you like this <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>man</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="man" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span>'s sisters, too, do you? Their manners are not equal to his."
<p>"Certainly not - - at first. But they are very pleasing women when you converse with them. Miss Bingley is to live with her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>brother</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="brother" newWord="family" score="0.996">family</span>, and keep his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>house</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="house" newWord="brother" score="0.989">brother</span>; and I am much mistaken if we shall not find a very charming <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>neighbour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.762" formerWord="neighbour" newWord="way" score="0.762">way</span> in her."
<p>Elizabeth listened in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>silence</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.956" formerWord="silence" newWord="sister" score="0.956">sister</span>, but was not convinced; their <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>behaviour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.947" formerWord="behaviour" newWord="family" score="0.947">family</span> at the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>assembly</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.441" formerWord="assembly" newWord="horror" score="0.441">horror</span> had not been calculated to please in general; and with more <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>quickness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.691" formerWord="quickness" newWord="horror" score="0.691">horror</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>observation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.85" formerWord="observation" newWord="minute" score="0.85">minute</span> and less pliancy of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>temper</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.897" formerWord="temper" newWord="woman" score="0.897">woman</span> than her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span>, and with a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>judgement</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.797" formerWord="judgement" newWord="son" score="0.797">son</span> too unassailed by any <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>attention</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.951" formerWord="attention" newWord="brother" score="0.951">brother</span> to herself, she was very little disposed to approve them. They were in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fact</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.815" formerWord="fact" newWord="woman" score="0.815">woman</span> very fine ladies; not deficient in good <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>humour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.929" formerWord="humour" newWord="journey" score="0.929">journey</span> when they were pleased, nor in the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>power</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.887" formerWord="power" newWord="nothing" score="0.887">nothing</span> of making themselves agreeable when they chose it, but proud and conceited. They were rather handsome, had been educated in one of the first private seminaries in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>town</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="town" newWord="brother" score="0.991">brother</span>, had a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fortune</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.975" formerWord="fortune" newWord="man" score="0.975">man</span> of twenty thousand pounds, were in the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>habit</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.527" formerWord="habit" newWord="profession" score="0.527">profession</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>spending</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.569" formerWord="spending" newWord="observation" score="0.569">observation</span> more than they ought, and of associating with people of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>rank</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.766" formerWord="rank" newWord="minute" score="0.766">minute</span>, and were therefore in every <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>respect</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.955" formerWord="respect" newWord="happiness" score="0.955">happiness</span> entitled to think well of themselves, and meanly of others. They were of a respectable <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>family</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="family" newWord="brother" score="0.996">brother</span> in the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>north</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.597" formerWord="north" newWord="nature" score="0.597">nature</span> of England; a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>circumstance</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.973" formerWord="circumstance" newWord="thing" score="0.973">thing</span> more deeply impressed on their memories than that their <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>brother</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="brother" newWord="family" score="0.996">family</span>'s <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fortune</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.975" formerWord="fortune" newWord="man" score="0.975">man</span> and their own had been acquired by <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>trade</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.326" formerWord="trade" newWord="avoidance" score="0.326">avoidance</span>. 
<p>Mr. Bingley inherited <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>property</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.737" formerWord="property" newWord="degree" score="0.737">degree</span> to the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>amount</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.481" formerWord="amount" newWord="tone" score="0.481">tone</span> of nearly a hundred thousand pounds from his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>father</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.95" formerWord="father" newWord="aunt" score="0.95">aunt</span>, who had intended to purchase an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>estate</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.87" formerWord="estate" newWord="woman" score="0.87">woman</span>, but did not live to do it. Mr. Bingley intended it likewise, and sometimes made <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>choice</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.949" formerWord="choice" newWord="happiness" score="0.949">happiness</span> of his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>county</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.275" formerWord="county" newWord="innocence" score="0.275">innocence</span>; but as he was now provided with a good <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>house</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="house" newWord="brother" score="0.989">brother</span> and the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>liberty</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.724" formerWord="liberty" newWord="part" score="0.724">part</span> of a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>manor</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.227" formerWord="manor" newWord="despatch" score="0.227">despatch</span>, it was doubtful to many of those who best knew the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>easiness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.344" formerWord="easiness" newWord="error" score="0.344">error</span> of his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>temper</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.897" formerWord="temper" newWord="woman" score="0.897">woman</span>, whether he might not spend the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>remainder</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.441" formerWord="remainder" newWord="field" score="0.441">field</span> of his days at Netherfield, and leave the next <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>generation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.226" formerWord="generation" newWord="condescension" score="0.226">condescension</span> to purchase. 
<p>His sisters were anxious for his having an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>estate</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.87" formerWord="estate" newWord="woman" score="0.87">woman</span> of his own; but, though he was now only established as a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>tenant</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.285" formerWord="tenant" newWord="despondence" score="0.285">despondence</span>, Miss Bingley was by no means unwilling to preside at his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>table</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.548" formerWord="table" newWord="morning" score="0.548">morning</span> - - nor was Mrs. Hurst, who had married a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>man</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="man" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span> of more <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fashion</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.531" formerWord="fashion" newWord="persuasion" score="0.531">persuasion</span> than <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fortune</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.975" formerWord="fortune" newWord="man" score="0.975">man</span>, less disposed to consider his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>house</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="house" newWord="brother" score="0.989">brother</span> as her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>home</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.985" formerWord="home" newWord="day" score="0.985">day</span> when it suited her. Mr. Bingley had not been of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>age</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.975" formerWord="age" newWord="affection" score="0.975">affection</span> two years, when he was tempted by an accidental <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>recommendation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.689" formerWord="recommendation" newWord="conviction" score="0.689">conviction</span> to look at Netherfield House. He did look at it, and into it for <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>half-an-hour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.477" formerWord="half-an-hour" newWord="regret" score="0.477">regret</span> - - was pleased with the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>situation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.988" formerWord="situation" newWord="family" score="0.988">family</span> and the principal rooms, satisfied with what the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>owner</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.566" formerWord="owner" newWord="friendship" score="0.566">friendship</span> said in its <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>praise</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.948" formerWord="praise" newWord="time" score="0.948">time</span>, and took it immediately. 
<p>Between him and Darcy there was a very steady <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>friendship</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.964" formerWord="friendship" newWord="time" score="0.964">time</span>, in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>spite</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.961" formerWord="spite" newWord="man" score="0.961">man</span> of great <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>opposition</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.509" formerWord="opposition" newWord="justice" score="0.509">justice</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>character</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.977" formerWord="character" newWord="family" score="0.977">family</span>. Bingley was endeared to Darcy by the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>easiness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.344" formerWord="easiness" newWord="error" score="0.344">error</span>, <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>openness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.459" formerWord="openness" newWord="wedding" score="0.459">wedding</span>, and ductility of his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>temper</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.897" formerWord="temper" newWord="woman" score="0.897">woman</span>, though no <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>disposition</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.799" formerWord="disposition" newWord="minute" score="0.799">minute</span> could offer a greater <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>contrast</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.349" formerWord="contrast" newWord="entertainment" score="0.349">entertainment</span> to his own, and though with his own he never appeared dissatisfied. On the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>strength</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.924" formerWord="strength" newWord="happiness" score="0.924">happiness</span> of Darcy's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>regard</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.953" formerWord="regard" newWord="family" score="0.953">family</span>, Bingley had the firmest <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>reliance</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.613" formerWord="reliance" newWord="observation" score="0.613">observation</span>, and of his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>judgement</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.797" formerWord="judgement" newWord="son" score="0.797">son</span> the highest <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>opinion</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.977" formerWord="opinion" newWord="nothing" score="0.977">nothing</span>. In <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>understanding</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.721" formerWord="understanding" newWord="dinner" score="0.721">dinner</span>, Darcy was the superior. Bingley was by no means deficient, but Darcy was clever. He was at the same <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>time</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="time" newWord="family" score="0.995">family</span> haughty, reserved, and fastidious, and his manners, though well-bred, were not inviting. In that respect his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>friend</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="friend" newWord="brother" score="0.994">brother</span> had greatly the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>advantage</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.583" formerWord="advantage" newWord="minute" score="0.583">minute</span>. Bingley was sure of being liked wherever he appeared, Darcy was continually giving <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>offense</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.277" formerWord="offense" newWord="rate" score="0.277">rate</span>. 
<p>The <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>manner</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.917" formerWord="manner" newWord="kind" score="0.917">kind</span> in which they spoke of the Meryton <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>assembly</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.441" formerWord="assembly" newWord="horror" score="0.441">horror</span> was sufficiently characteristic. Bingley had never met with more pleasant people or prettier girls in his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>life</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="life" newWord="family" score="0.994">family</span>; <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>everybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.754" formerWord="everybody" newWord="word" score="0.754">word</span> had been most <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>kind</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="kind" newWord="nothing" score="0.99">nothing</span> and attentive to him; there had been no <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>formality</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.709" formerWord="formality" newWord="life" score="0.709">life</span>, no <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>stiffness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.383" formerWord="stiffness" newWord="consciousness" score="0.383">consciousness</span>; he had soon felt acquainted with all the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>room</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.972" formerWord="room" newWord="course" score="0.972">course</span>; and, as to Miss Bennet, he could not conceive an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>angel</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.423" formerWord="angel" newWord="inspection" score="0.423">inspection</span> more beautiful. Darcy, on the contrary, had seen a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>collection</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.65" formerWord="collection" newWord="observation" score="0.65">observation</span> of people in whom there was little <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>beauty</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.975" formerWord="beauty" newWord="family" score="0.975">family</span> and no <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fashion</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.531" formerWord="fashion" newWord="persuasion" score="0.531">persuasion</span>, for <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>none</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.986" formerWord="none" newWord="brother" score="0.986">brother</span> of whom he had felt the smallest <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>interest</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.981" formerWord="interest" newWord="family" score="0.981">family</span>, and from <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>none</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.986" formerWord="none" newWord="brother" score="0.986">brother</span> received either <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>attention</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.951" formerWord="attention" newWord="brother" score="0.951">brother</span> or <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pleasure</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="pleasure" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span>. Miss Bennet he acknowledged to be pretty, but she smiled too much. 
<p>Mrs. Hurst and her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span> allowed it to be so - - but still they admired her and liked her, and pronounced her to be a sweet <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>girl</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.988" formerWord="girl" newWord="man" score="0.988">man</span>, and <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>one</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.909" formerWord="one" newWord="rest" score="0.909">rest</span> whom they would not object to know more of. Miss Bennet was therefore established as a sweet <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>girl</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.988" formerWord="girl" newWord="man" score="0.988">man</span>, and their <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>brother</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="brother" newWord="family" score="0.996">family</span> felt authorized by such <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>commendation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.256" formerWord="commendation" newWord="hush" score="0.256">hush</span> to think of her as he chose. 
<p>
<p>
<p>Chapter 5 
<p>
<p>Within a short <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>walk</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.978" formerWord="walk" newWord="friend" score="0.978">friend</span> of Longbourn lived a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>family</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="family" newWord="brother" score="0.996">brother</span> with whom the Bennets were particularly intimate. Sir William Lucas had been formerly in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>trade</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.326" formerWord="trade" newWord="avoidance" score="0.326">avoidance</span> in Meryton, where he had made a tolerable <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fortune</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.975" formerWord="fortune" newWord="man" score="0.975">man</span>, and risen to the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>honour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.986" formerWord="honour" newWord="happiness" score="0.986">happiness</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>knighthood</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.499" formerWord="knighthood" newWord="park" score="0.499">park</span> by an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>address</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.729" formerWord="address" newWord="justice" score="0.729">justice</span> to the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>king</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.237" formerWord="king" newWord="card-table" score="0.237">card-table</span> during his mayoralty. The <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>distinction</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.533" formerWord="distinction" newWord="weather" score="0.533">weather</span> had perhaps been felt too strongly. It had given him a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>disgust</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.825" formerWord="disgust" newWord="honour" score="0.825">honour</span> to his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>business</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.981" formerWord="business" newWord="time" score="0.981">time</span>, and to his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>residence</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.804" formerWord="residence" newWord="letter" score="0.804">letter</span> in a small <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>market</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.483" formerWord="market" newWord="ease" score="0.483">ease</span> <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>town</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="town" newWord="brother" score="0.991">brother</span>; and, in quitting them both, he had removed with his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>family</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="family" newWord="brother" score="0.996">brother</span> to a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>house</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="house" newWord="brother" score="0.989">brother</span> about a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>mile</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.801" formerWord="mile" newWord="minute" score="0.801">minute</span> from Meryton, denominated from that <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>period</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.944" formerWord="period" newWord="sister" score="0.944">sister</span> Lucas Lodge, where he could think with <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pleasure</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="pleasure" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> of his own <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>importance</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.289" formerWord="importance" newWord="fruit" score="0.289">fruit</span>, and, unshackled by <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>business</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.981" formerWord="business" newWord="time" score="0.981">time</span>, occupy himself solely in being civil to all the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>world</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.982" formerWord="world" newWord="man" score="0.982">man</span>. For, though elated by his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>rank</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.766" formerWord="rank" newWord="minute" score="0.766">minute</span>, it did not render him supercilious; on the contrary, he was all <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>attention</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.951" formerWord="attention" newWord="brother" score="0.951">brother</span> to <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>everybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.754" formerWord="everybody" newWord="word" score="0.754">word</span>. By <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nature</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.94" formerWord="nature" newWord="time" score="0.94">time</span> inoffensive, friendly, and obliging, his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>presentation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.23" formerWord="presentation" newWord="learning" score="0.23">learning</span> at St. James's had made him courteous. 
<p>Lady Lucas was a very good <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>kind</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="kind" newWord="nothing" score="0.99">nothing</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>woman</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="woman" newWord="man" score="0.99">man</span>, not too clever to be a valuable <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>neighbour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.762" formerWord="neighbour" newWord="way" score="0.762">way</span> to Mrs. Bennet. They had several children. The eldest of them, a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sensible</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.798" formerWord="sensible" newWord="conversation" score="0.798">conversation</span>, intelligent young <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>woman</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="woman" newWord="man" score="0.99">man</span>, about twenty-seven, was Elizabeth's intimate <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>friend</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="friend" newWord="brother" score="0.994">brother</span>. 
<p>That the Miss Lucases and the Miss Bennets should meet to talk over a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>ball</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.985" formerWord="ball" newWord="friend" score="0.985">friend</span> was absolutely necessary; and the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>morning</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.987" formerWord="morning" newWord="day" score="0.987">day</span> after the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>assembly</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.441" formerWord="assembly" newWord="horror" score="0.441">horror</span> brought the former to Longbourn to hear and to communicate. 
<p>"You began the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>evening</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.985" formerWord="evening" newWord="day" score="0.985">day</span> well, Charlotte,"said Mrs. Bennet with civil <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>self-command</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.516" formerWord="self-command" newWord="health" score="0.516">health</span> to Miss Lucas."You were Mr. Bingley's first <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>choice</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.949" formerWord="choice" newWord="happiness" score="0.949">happiness</span>."
<p>"<span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>Yes</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.883" formerWord="Yes" newWord="honour" score="0.883">Honour</span>; but he seemed to like his second better."
<p>"Oh! you mean Jane, I suppose, because he danced with her twice. To be sure that did seem as if he admired her - - indeed I rather believe he did - - I heard <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>something</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.851" formerWord="something" newWord="mind" score="0.851">mind</span> about it - - but I hardly know what - - <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>something</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.851" formerWord="something" newWord="mind" score="0.851">mind</span> about Mr. Robinson."
<p>"Perhaps you mean what I overheard between him and Mr. Robinson; did not I mention it to you? Mr. Robinson's asking him how he liked our Meryton assemblies, and whether he did not think there were a great many pretty women in the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>room</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.972" formerWord="room" newWord="course" score="0.972">course</span>, and which he thought the prettiest? and his answering immediately to the last <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>question</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.962" formerWord="question" newWord="time" score="0.962">time</span>: ' Oh! the eldest Miss Bennet, beyond a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>doubt</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.985" formerWord="doubt" newWord="family" score="0.985">family</span>; there cannot be two opinions on that <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>point</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.974" formerWord="point" newWord="brother" score="0.974">brother</span>. '"
<p>"Upon my <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>word</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.969" formerWord="word" newWord="sister" score="0.969">sister</span>! Well, that is very decided indeed - - that does seem as if - - but, however, it may all come to <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nothing</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="nothing" newWord="course" score="0.991">course</span>, you know."
<p>"My overhearings were more to the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>purpose</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.828" formerWord="purpose" newWord="part" score="0.828">part</span> than yours, Eliza,"said Charlotte."Mr. Darcy is not so well worth listening to as his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>friend</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="friend" newWord="brother" score="0.994">brother</span>, is he? - - poor <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>Eliza</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.243" formerWord="Eliza" newWord="humanity" score="0.243">Humanity</span>! - - to be only just tolerable."
<p>"I beg you would not put it into Lizzy's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>head</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.883" formerWord="head" newWord="occasion" score="0.883">occasion</span> to be vexed by his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>ill-treatment</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.306" formerWord="ill-treatment" newWord="earl" score="0.306">earl</span>, for he is such a disagreeable <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>man</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="man" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span>, that it would be quite a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>misfortune</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.748" formerWord="misfortune" newWord="son" score="0.748">son</span> to be liked by him. Mrs. Long told me last <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>night</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.946" formerWord="night" newWord="life" score="0.946">life</span> that he sat close to her for <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>half-an-hour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.477" formerWord="half-an-hour" newWord="regret" score="0.477">regret</span> without once opening his lips."
<p>"Are you quite sure, <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>ma'am</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.966" formerWord="ma'am" newWord="family" score="0.966">family</span>? - - is not there a little <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>mistake</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.949" formerWord="mistake" newWord="time" score="0.949">time</span>?"said Jane."I certainly saw Mr. Darcy <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>speaking</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.974" formerWord="speaking" newWord="family" score="0.974">family</span> to her."
<p>"Aye - - because she asked him at last how he liked Netherfield, and he could not help answering her; but she said he seemed quite angry at being spoke to."
<p>"Miss Bingley told me,"said Jane,"that he never speaks much, unless among his intimate acquaintances. With them he is remarkably agreeable."
<p>"I do not believe a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>word</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.969" formerWord="word" newWord="sister" score="0.969">sister</span> of it, my dear. If he had been so very agreeable, he would have talked to Mrs. Long. But I can guess how it was; <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>everybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.754" formerWord="everybody" newWord="word" score="0.754">word</span> says that he is eat up with <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pride</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.973" formerWord="pride" newWord="sister" score="0.973">sister</span>, and I dare say he had heard somehow that Mrs. Long does not keep a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>carriage</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.986" formerWord="carriage" newWord="brother" score="0.986">brother</span>, and had come to the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>ball</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.985" formerWord="ball" newWord="friend" score="0.985">friend</span> in a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>hack</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.216" formerWord="hack" newWord="evergreen" score="0.216">evergreen</span> <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>chaise</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.298" formerWord="chaise" newWord="met" score="0.298">met</span>."
<p>"I do not mind his not talking to Mrs. Long,"said Miss Lucas,"but I wish he had danced with Eliza."
<p>"Another <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>time</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="time" newWord="family" score="0.995">family</span>, Lizzy,"said her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>mother</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="mother" newWord="sister" score="0.989">sister</span>,"I would not <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>dance</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.902" formerWord="dance" newWord="answer" score="0.902">answer</span> with him, if I were you."
<p>"I believe, <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>ma'am</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.966" formerWord="ma'am" newWord="family" score="0.966">family</span>, I may safely promise you never to dance with him."
<p>"His <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pride</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.973" formerWord="pride" newWord="sister" score="0.973">sister</span>,"said Miss Lucas,"does not offend me so much as <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pride</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.973" formerWord="pride" newWord="sister" score="0.973">sister</span> often does, because there is an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>excuse</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.41" formerWord="excuse" newWord="experience" score="0.41">experience</span> for it. One cannot wonder that so very <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fine</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.259" formerWord="fine" newWord="hint" score="0.259">hint</span> a young <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>man</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="man" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span>, with <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>family</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="family" newWord="brother" score="0.996">brother</span>, <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fortune</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.975" formerWord="fortune" newWord="man" score="0.975">man</span>, <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>everything</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="everything" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span> in his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>favour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.976" formerWord="favour" newWord="time" score="0.976">time</span>, should think highly of himself. If I may so express it, he has a right to be proud."
<p>"That is very true,"replied Elizabeth,"and I could easily forgive his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pride</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.973" formerWord="pride" newWord="sister" score="0.973">sister</span>, if he had not mortified <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>mine</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.351" formerWord="mine" newWord="companion" score="0.351">companion</span>."
<p>"Pride,"observed Mary, who piqued herself upon the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>solidity</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.23" formerWord="solidity" newWord="sunk" score="0.23">sunk</span> of her reflections,"is a very common failing, I believe. By all that I have ever read, I am convinced that it is very common indeed; that human <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nature</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.94" formerWord="nature" newWord="time" score="0.94">time</span> is particularly prone to it, and that there are very few of us who do not cherish a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>feeling</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="feeling" newWord="time" score="0.979">time</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>self-complacency</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.257" formerWord="self-complacency" newWord="adieus" score="0.257">adieus</span> on the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>score</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.394" formerWord="score" newWord="poetry" score="0.394">poetry</span> of some <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>quality</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.526" formerWord="quality" newWord="money" score="0.526">money</span> or other, real or imaginary. Vanity and <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pride</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.973" formerWord="pride" newWord="sister" score="0.973">sister</span> are different things, though the words are often used synonymously. A <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>person</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.947" formerWord="person" newWord="time" score="0.947">time</span> may be proud without being vain. Pride relates more to our <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>opinion</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.977" formerWord="opinion" newWord="nothing" score="0.977">nothing</span> of ourselves, <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>vanity</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.921" formerWord="vanity" newWord="woman" score="0.921">woman</span> to what we would have others think of us."
<p>"If I were as rich as Mr. Darcy,"cried a young Lucas, who came with his sisters,"I should not care how proud I was. I would keep a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pack</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.247" formerWord="pack" newWord="awkwardness" score="0.247">awkwardness</span> of foxhounds, and drink a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>bottle</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.725" formerWord="bottle" newWord="evening" score="0.725">evening</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>wine</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.445" formerWord="wine" newWord="horror" score="0.445">horror</span> a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>day</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="day" newWord="family" score="0.994">family</span>."
<p>"Then you would drink a great <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>deal</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="deal" newWord="brother" score="0.989">brother</span> more than you ought,"said Mrs. Bennet;"and if I were to see you at it, I should take away your <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>bottle</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.725" formerWord="bottle" newWord="evening" score="0.725">evening</span> directly."
<p>The <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>boy</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.384" formerWord="boy" newWord="firmness" score="0.384">firmness</span> protested that she should not; she continued to declare that she would, and the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>argument</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.796" formerWord="argument" newWord="surprise" score="0.796">surprise</span> ended only with the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>visit</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.95" formerWord="visit" newWord="day" score="0.95">day</span>. 
<p>
<p>
<p>Chapter 6 
<p>
<p>The ladies of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>Longbourn</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.971" formerWord="Longbourn" newWord="family" score="0.971">Family</span> soon waited on those of Netherfield. The <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>visit</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.95" formerWord="visit" newWord="day" score="0.95">day</span> was soon returned in due <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>form</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.832" formerWord="form" newWord="aunt" score="0.832">aunt</span>. Miss Bennet's pleasing manners grew on the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>goodwill</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.568" formerWord="goodwill" newWord="fancy" score="0.568">fancy</span> of Mrs. Hurst and Miss Bingley; and though the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>mother</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="mother" newWord="sister" score="0.989">sister</span> was found to be intolerable, and the younger sisters not worth <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>speaking</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.974" formerWord="speaking" newWord="family" score="0.974">family</span> to, a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>wish</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="wish" newWord="brother" score="0.99">brother</span> of being better acquainted with them was expressed towards the two eldest. By Jane, this <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>attention</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.951" formerWord="attention" newWord="brother" score="0.951">brother</span> was received with the greatest <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pleasure</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="pleasure" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span>, but Elizabeth still saw <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>superciliousness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.575" formerWord="superciliousness" newWord="impression" score="0.575">impression</span> in their <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>treatment</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.27" formerWord="treatment" newWord="dressing" score="0.27">dressing</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>everybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.754" formerWord="everybody" newWord="word" score="0.754">word</span>, hardly excepting even her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span>, and could not like them; though their <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>kindness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.973" formerWord="kindness" newWord="brother" score="0.973">brother</span> to Jane, such as it was, had a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>value</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.915" formerWord="value" newWord="ball" score="0.915">ball</span> as arising in all <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>probability</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.849" formerWord="probability" newWord="family" score="0.849">family</span> from the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>influence</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.957" formerWord="influence" newWord="friend" score="0.957">friend</span> of their <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>brother</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="brother" newWord="family" score="0.996">family</span>'s <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>admiration</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.893" formerWord="admiration" newWord="nothing" score="0.893">nothing</span>. It was generally evident whenever they met, that he did admire her and to her it was equally evident that Jane was yielding to the preference which she had begun to entertain for him from the first, and was in a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>way</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="way" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> to be very much in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>love</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="love" newWord="man" score="0.984">man</span>; but she considered with <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pleasure</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="pleasure" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> that it was not likely to be discovered by the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>world</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.982" formerWord="world" newWord="man" score="0.982">man</span> in general, since Jane united, with great <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>strength</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.924" formerWord="strength" newWord="happiness" score="0.924">happiness</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>feeling</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="feeling" newWord="time" score="0.979">time</span>, a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>composure</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.776" formerWord="composure" newWord="minute" score="0.776">minute</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>temper</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.897" formerWord="temper" newWord="woman" score="0.897">woman</span> and a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>uniform</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.29" formerWord="uniform" newWord="offer" score="0.29">offer</span> <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>cheerfulness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.542" formerWord="cheerfulness" newWord="absence" score="0.542">absence</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>manner</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.917" formerWord="manner" newWord="kind" score="0.917">kind</span> which would guard her from the suspicions of the impertinent. She mentioned this to her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>friend</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="friend" newWord="brother" score="0.994">brother</span> Miss Lucas. 
<p>"It may perhaps be pleasant,"replied Charlotte,"to be able to impose on the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>public</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.507" formerWord="public" newWord="housekeeper" score="0.507">housekeeper</span> in such a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>case</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.944" formerWord="case" newWord="brother" score="0.944">brother</span>; but it is sometimes a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>disadvantage</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.248" formerWord="disadvantage" newWord="security" score="0.248">security</span> to be so very guarded. If a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>woman</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="woman" newWord="man" score="0.99">man</span> conceals her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>affection</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="affection" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span> with the same <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>skill</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.353" formerWord="skill" newWord="devotion" score="0.353">devotion</span> from the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>object</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.974" formerWord="object" newWord="day" score="0.974">day</span> of it, she may lose the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>opportunity</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.967" formerWord="opportunity" newWord="day" score="0.967">day</span> of fixing him; and it will then be but poor <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>consolation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.853" formerWord="consolation" newWord="money" score="0.853">money</span> to believe the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>world</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.982" formerWord="world" newWord="man" score="0.982">man</span> equally in the dark. There is so much of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>gratitude</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.969" formerWord="gratitude" newWord="affection" score="0.969">affection</span> or <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>vanity</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.921" formerWord="vanity" newWord="woman" score="0.921">woman</span> in almost every <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>attachment</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.684" formerWord="attachment" newWord="deal" score="0.684">deal</span>, that it is not safe to leave any to itself. We can all begin freely - - a slight preference is natural enough; but there are very few of us who have <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>heart</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="heart" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> enough to be really in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>love</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="love" newWord="man" score="0.984">man</span> without <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>encouragement</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.955" formerWord="encouragement" newWord="brother" score="0.955">brother</span>. In nine cases out of ten a women had better <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>show</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.235" formerWord="show" newWord="neglect" score="0.235">neglect</span> more <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>affection</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="affection" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span> than she feels. Bingley likes your <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span> undoubtedly; but he may never do more than like her, if she does not help him on."
<p>"But she does help him on, as much as her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nature</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.94" formerWord="nature" newWord="time" score="0.94">time</span> will allow. If I can perceive her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>regard</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.953" formerWord="regard" newWord="family" score="0.953">family</span> for him, he must be a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>simpleton</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.64" formerWord="simpleton" newWord="ease" score="0.64">ease</span>, indeed, not to discover it too."
<p>"Remember, Eliza, that he does not know Jane's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>disposition</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.799" formerWord="disposition" newWord="minute" score="0.799">minute</span> as you do."
<p>"But if a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>woman</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="woman" newWord="man" score="0.99">man</span> is partial to a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>man</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="man" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span>, and does not <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>endeavour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.35" formerWord="endeavour" newWord="person" score="0.35">person</span> to conceal it, he must find it out."
<p>"Perhaps he must, if he sees enough of her. But, though Bingley and Jane meet tolerably often, it is never for many hours together; and, as they always see each other in large mixed parties, it is impossible that every <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>moment</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.932" formerWord="moment" newWord="honour" score="0.932">honour</span> should be employed in conversing together. Jane should therefore make the most of every <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>half-hour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.532" formerWord="half-hour" newWord="partner" score="0.532">partner</span> in which she can command his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>attention</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.951" formerWord="attention" newWord="brother" score="0.951">brother</span>. When she is secure of him, there will be more <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>leisure</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.307" formerWord="leisure" newWord="station" score="0.307">station</span> for falling in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>love</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="love" newWord="man" score="0.984">man</span> as much as she chooses."
<p>"Your <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>plan</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.79" formerWord="plan" newWord="pleasure" score="0.79">pleasure</span> is a good one,"replied Elizabeth,"where <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nothing</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="nothing" newWord="course" score="0.991">course</span> is in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>question</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.962" formerWord="question" newWord="time" score="0.962">time</span> but the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>desire</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.856" formerWord="desire" newWord="kindness" score="0.856">kindness</span> of being well married, and if I were determined to get a rich <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>husband</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="husband" newWord="brother" score="0.979">brother</span>, or any <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>husband</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="husband" newWord="brother" score="0.979">brother</span>, I dare say I should adopt it. But these are not Jane's feelings; she is not acting by <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>design</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.429" formerWord="design" newWord="wife" score="0.429">wife</span>. As yet, she cannot even be certain of the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>degree</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.982" formerWord="degree" newWord="sister" score="0.982">sister</span> of her own <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>regard</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.953" formerWord="regard" newWord="family" score="0.953">family</span> nor of its <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>reasonableness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.411" formerWord="reasonableness" newWord="kitchen" score="0.411">kitchen</span>. She has known him only a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fortnight</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.96" formerWord="fortnight" newWord="affection" score="0.96">affection</span>. She danced four dances with him at Meryton; she saw him <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>one</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.909" formerWord="one" newWord="rest" score="0.909">rest</span> <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>morning</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.987" formerWord="morning" newWord="day" score="0.987">day</span> at his own <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>house</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="house" newWord="brother" score="0.989">brother</span>, and has since dined with him in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>company</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.987" formerWord="company" newWord="brother" score="0.987">brother</span> four times. This is not quite enough to make her understand his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>character</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.977" formerWord="character" newWord="family" score="0.977">family</span>."
<p>"Not as you represent it. Had she merely dined with him, she might only have discovered whether he had a good <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>appetite</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.268" formerWord="appetite" newWord="sincerity" score="0.268">sincerity</span>; but you must remember that four evenings have also been spent together - - and four evenings may do a great <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>deal</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="deal" newWord="brother" score="0.989">brother</span>."
<p>"<span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>Yes</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.883" formerWord="Yes" newWord="honour" score="0.883">Honour</span>; these four evenings have enabled them to ascertain that they both like Vingt-un better than Commerce; but with <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>respect</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.955" formerWord="respect" newWord="happiness" score="0.955">happiness</span> to any other leading characteristic, I do not imagine that much has been unfolded."
<p>"Well,"said Charlotte,"I wish Jane <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>success</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.888" formerWord="success" newWord="man" score="0.888">man</span> with all my <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>heart</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="heart" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span>; and if she were married to him to-morrow, I should think she had as good a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>chance</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.924" formerWord="chance" newWord="time" score="0.924">time</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>happiness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="happiness" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span> as if she were to be studying his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>character</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.977" formerWord="character" newWord="family" score="0.977">family</span> for a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>twelvemonth</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.723" formerWord="twelvemonth" newWord="answer" score="0.723">answer</span>. <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>Happiness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="Happiness" newWord="brother" score="0.992">Brother</span> in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>marriage</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="marriage" newWord="brother" score="0.991">brother</span> is entirely a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>matter</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.969" formerWord="matter" newWord="affection" score="0.969">affection</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>chance</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.924" formerWord="chance" newWord="time" score="0.924">time</span>. If the dispositions of the parties are ever so well known to each other or ever so similar beforehand, it does not advance their <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>felicity</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.883" formerWord="felicity" newWord="brother" score="0.883">brother</span> in the least. They always continue to grow sufficiently unlike afterwards to have their <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>share</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.466" formerWord="share" newWord="horror" score="0.466">horror</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>vexation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.248" formerWord="vexation" newWord="brilliancy" score="0.248">brilliancy</span>; and it is better to know as little as possible of the defects of the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>person</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.947" formerWord="person" newWord="time" score="0.947">time</span> with whom you are to pass your <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>life</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="life" newWord="family" score="0.994">family</span>."
<p>"You make me <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>laugh</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.578" formerWord="laugh" newWord="horror" score="0.578">horror</span>, Charlotte; but it is not sound. You know it is not sound, and that you would never act in this <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>way</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="way" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> yourself."
<p>Occupied in observing Mr. Bingley's attentions to her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span>, Elizabeth was far from suspecting that she was herself becoming an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>object</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.974" formerWord="object" newWord="day" score="0.974">day</span> of some <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>interest</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.981" formerWord="interest" newWord="family" score="0.981">family</span> in the eyes of his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>friend</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="friend" newWord="brother" score="0.994">brother</span>. Mr. Darcy had at first scarcely allowed her to be pretty; he had looked at her without <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>admiration</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.893" formerWord="admiration" newWord="nothing" score="0.893">nothing</span> at the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>ball</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.985" formerWord="ball" newWord="friend" score="0.985">friend</span>; and when they next met, he looked at her only to criticise. But no <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sooner</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.892" formerWord="sooner" newWord="town" score="0.892">town</span> had he made it clear to himself and his friends that she hardly had a good <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>feature</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.321" formerWord="feature" newWord="shut" score="0.321">shut</span> in her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>face</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.255" formerWord="face" newWord="reproach" score="0.255">reproach</span>, than he began to find it was rendered uncommonly intelligent by the beautiful <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>expression</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.794" formerWord="expression" newWord="woman" score="0.794">woman</span> of her dark eyes. To this <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>discovery</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.588" formerWord="discovery" newWord="trouble" score="0.588">trouble</span> succeeded some others equally mortifying. Though he had detected with a critical <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>eye</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.94" formerWord="eye" newWord="appearance" score="0.94">appearance</span> more than one <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>failure</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.36" formerWord="failure" newWord="consciousness" score="0.36">consciousness</span> of perfect symmetry in her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>form</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.832" formerWord="form" newWord="aunt" score="0.832">aunt</span>, he was forced to acknowledge her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>figure</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.834" formerWord="figure" newWord="week" score="0.834">week</span> to be light and <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pleasing</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.321" formerWord="pleasing" newWord="relationship" score="0.321">relationship</span>; and in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>spite</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.961" formerWord="spite" newWord="man" score="0.961">man</span> of his asserting that her manners were not those of the fashionable <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>world</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.982" formerWord="world" newWord="man" score="0.982">man</span>, he was caught by their easy <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>playfulness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.258" formerWord="playfulness" newWord="hardness" score="0.258">hardness</span>. Of this she was perfectly unaware; to her he was only the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>man</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="man" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span> who made himself agreeable nowhere, and who had not thought her handsome enough to dance with. 
<p>He began to wish to know more of her, and as a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>step</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.724" formerWord="step" newWord="round" score="0.724">round</span> towards conversing with her himself, attended to her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>conversation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.981" formerWord="conversation" newWord="friend" score="0.981">friend</span> with others. His doing so drew her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>notice</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.937" formerWord="notice" newWord="her" score="0.937">her</span>. It was at Sir William Lucas ' s, where a large <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>party</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.982" formerWord="party" newWord="family" score="0.982">family</span> were assembled. 
<p>"What does Mr. Darcy <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>mean</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.579" formerWord="mean" newWord="longbourn" score="0.579">longbourn</span>,"said she to Charlotte,"by listening to my <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>conversation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.981" formerWord="conversation" newWord="friend" score="0.981">friend</span> with Colonel Forster?"
<p>"That is a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>question</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.962" formerWord="question" newWord="time" score="0.962">time</span> which Mr. Darcy only can answer."
<p>"But if he does it any more I shall certainly let him know that I see what he is about. He has a very satirical <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>eye</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.94" formerWord="eye" newWord="appearance" score="0.94">appearance</span>, and if I do not begin by being impertinent myself, I shall soon grow afraid of him."
<p>On his approaching them soon afterwards, though without seeming to have any <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>intention</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.68" formerWord="intention" newWord="world" score="0.68">world</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>speaking</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.974" formerWord="speaking" newWord="family" score="0.974">family</span>, Miss Lucas defied her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>friend</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="friend" newWord="brother" score="0.994">brother</span> to mention such a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>subject</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="subject" newWord="friend" score="0.979">friend</span> to him; which immediately provoking Elizabeth to do it, she turned to him and said: 
<p>"Did you not think, Mr. Darcy, that I expressed myself uncommonly well just now, when I was teasing Colonel Forster to give us a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>ball</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.985" formerWord="ball" newWord="friend" score="0.985">friend</span> at Meryton?"
<p>"With great <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>energy</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.335" formerWord="energy" newWord="good" score="0.335">good</span>; but it is always a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>subject</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="subject" newWord="friend" score="0.979">friend</span> which makes a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>lady</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.791" formerWord="lady" newWord="husband" score="0.791">husband</span> energetic."
<p>"You are severe on us."
<p>"It will be her turn soon to be teased,"said Miss Lucas."I am going to open the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>instrument</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.594" formerWord="instrument" newWord="case" score="0.594">case</span>, Eliza, and you know what follows."
<p>"You are a very strange <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>creature</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.777" formerWord="creature" newWord="woman" score="0.777">woman</span> by <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>way</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="way" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> of a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>friend</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="friend" newWord="brother" score="0.994">brother</span>! - - always wanting me to play and sing before <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>anybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.969" formerWord="anybody" newWord="way" score="0.969">way</span> and <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>everybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.754" formerWord="everybody" newWord="word" score="0.754">word</span>! If my <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>vanity</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.921" formerWord="vanity" newWord="woman" score="0.921">woman</span> had taken a musical <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>turn</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.281" formerWord="turn" newWord="control" score="0.281">control</span>, you would have been invaluable; but as it is, I would really rather not sit down before those who must be in the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>habit</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.527" formerWord="habit" newWord="profession" score="0.527">profession</span> of hearing the very best performers."On Miss Lucas's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>persevering</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.264" formerWord="persevering" newWord="calm" score="0.264">calm</span>, however, she added,"Very well, if it must be so, it must."And gravely glancing at Mr. Darcy,"There is a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fine</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.259" formerWord="fine" newWord="hint" score="0.259">hint</span> old saying, which <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>everybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.754" formerWord="everybody" newWord="word" score="0.754">word</span> here is of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>course</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.993" formerWord="course" newWord="brother" score="0.993">brother</span> familiar with: ' Keep your <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>breath</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.439" formerWord="breath" newWord="companion" score="0.439">companion</span> to cool your porridge '; and I shall keep <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>mine</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.351" formerWord="mine" newWord="companion" score="0.351">companion</span> to swell my <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>song</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.471" formerWord="song" newWord="card" score="0.471">card</span>."
<p>Her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>performance</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.309" formerWord="performance" newWord="though" score="0.309">though</span> was pleasing, though by no means <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>capital</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.871" formerWord="capital" newWord="doubt" score="0.871">doubt</span>. After a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>song</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.471" formerWord="song" newWord="card" score="0.471">card</span> or two, and before she could reply to the entreaties of several that she would sing again, she was eagerly succeeded at the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>instrument</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.594" formerWord="instrument" newWord="case" score="0.594">case</span> by her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span> Mary, who having, in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>consequence</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.902" formerWord="consequence" newWord="situation" score="0.902">situation</span> of being the only <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>plain</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.76" formerWord="plain" newWord="absence" score="0.76">absence</span> <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>one</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.909" formerWord="one" newWord="rest" score="0.909">rest</span> in the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>family</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="family" newWord="brother" score="0.996">brother</span>, worked hard for <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>knowledge</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.872" formerWord="knowledge" newWord="pleasure" score="0.872">pleasure</span> and accomplishments, was always <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>impatient</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.742" formerWord="impatient" newWord="news" score="0.742">news</span> for <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>display</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.816" formerWord="display" newWord="family" score="0.816">family</span>. 
<p>Mary had neither <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>genius</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.26" formerWord="genius" newWord="mirth" score="0.26">mirth</span> nor <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>taste</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.301" formerWord="taste" newWord="credit" score="0.301">credit</span>; and though <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>vanity</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.921" formerWord="vanity" newWord="woman" score="0.921">woman</span> had given her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>application</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.393" formerWord="application" newWord="agreement" score="0.393">agreement</span>, it had given her likewise a pedantic <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>air</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.491" formerWord="air" newWord="sea" score="0.491">sea</span> and conceited <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>manner</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.917" formerWord="manner" newWord="kind" score="0.917">kind</span>, which would have injured a higher <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>degree</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.982" formerWord="degree" newWord="sister" score="0.982">sister</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>excellence</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.432" formerWord="excellence" newWord="haste" score="0.432">haste</span> than she had reached. Elizabeth, easy and unaffected, had been listened to with much more <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pleasure</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="pleasure" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span>, though not playing <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>half</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.77" formerWord="half" newWord="minute" score="0.77">minute</span> so well; and Mary, at the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>end</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="end" newWord="time" score="0.984">time</span> of a long <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>concerto</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.61" formerWord="concerto" newWord="profession" score="0.61">profession</span>, was glad to purchase <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>praise</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.948" formerWord="praise" newWord="time" score="0.948">time</span> and <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>gratitude</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.969" formerWord="gratitude" newWord="affection" score="0.969">affection</span> by Scotch and Irish airs, at the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>request</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.808" formerWord="request" newWord="none" score="0.808">none</span> of her younger sisters, who, with some of the Lucases, and two or three officers, joined eagerly in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>dancing</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.962" formerWord="dancing" newWord="brother" score="0.962">brother</span> at one <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>end</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="end" newWord="time" score="0.984">time</span> of the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>room</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.972" formerWord="room" newWord="course" score="0.972">course</span>. 
<p>Mr. Darcy stood near them in silent <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>indignation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.908" formerWord="indignation" newWord="anything" score="0.908">anything</span> at such a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>mode</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.617" formerWord="mode" newWord="haste" score="0.617">haste</span> of passing the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>evening</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.985" formerWord="evening" newWord="day" score="0.985">day</span>, to the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>exclusion</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.566" formerWord="exclusion" newWord="door" score="0.566">door</span> of all <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>conversation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.981" formerWord="conversation" newWord="friend" score="0.981">friend</span>, and was too much engrossed by his thoughts to perceive that Sir William Lucas was his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>neighbour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.762" formerWord="neighbour" newWord="way" score="0.762">way</span>, till Sir William thus began: 
<p>"What a charming <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>amusement</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.86" formerWord="amusement" newWord="way" score="0.86">way</span> for young people this is, Mr. Darcy! There is <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nothing</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="nothing" newWord="course" score="0.991">course</span> like <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>dancing</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.962" formerWord="dancing" newWord="brother" score="0.962">brother</span> after all.
