After discharging his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>conscience</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.947" formerWord="conscience" newWord="happiness" score="0.947">happiness</span> on that <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>head</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.883" formerWord="head" newWord="occasion" score="0.883">occasion</span>, he proceeded to inform them, with many rapturous expressions, of his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>happiness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="happiness" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span> in having obtained the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>affection</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="affection" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span> of their amiable <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>neighbour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.762" formerWord="neighbour" newWord="way" score="0.762">way</span>, Miss Lucas, and then explained that it was merely with the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>view</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.375" formerWord="view" newWord="dirt" score="0.375">dirt</span> of enjoying her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>society</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="society" newWord="time" score="0.979">time</span> that he had been so ready to close with their <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>kind</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="kind" newWord="nothing" score="0.99">nothing</span> <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>wish</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="wish" newWord="brother" score="0.99">brother</span> of seeing him again at Longbourn, whither he hoped to be able to return on Monday <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fortnight</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.96" formerWord="fortnight" newWord="affection" score="0.96">affection</span>; for Lady Catherine, he added, so heartily approved his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>marriage</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="marriage" newWord="brother" score="0.991">brother</span>, that she wished it to take <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>place</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="place" newWord="family" score="0.99">family</span> as soon as possible, which he trusted would be an unanswerable <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>argument</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.796" formerWord="argument" newWord="surprise" score="0.796">surprise</span> with his amiable Charlotte to name an early <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>day</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="day" newWord="family" score="0.994">family</span> for making him the happiest of men. 
<p>Mr. Collins's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>return</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="return" newWord="brother" score="0.979">brother</span> into Hertfordshire was no longer a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>matter</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.969" formerWord="matter" newWord="affection" score="0.969">affection</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pleasure</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="pleasure" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> to Mrs. Bennet. On the contrary, she was as much disposed to complain of it as her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>husband</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="husband" newWord="brother" score="0.979">brother</span>. It was very strange that he should come to Longbourn instead of to Lucas Lodge; it was also very inconvenient and exceedingly troublesome. She hated having visitors in the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>house</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="house" newWord="brother" score="0.989">brother</span> while her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>health</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.937" formerWord="health" newWord="pleasure" score="0.937">pleasure</span> was so indifferent, and lovers were of all people the most disagreeable. Such were the gentle murmurs of Mrs. Bennet, and they gave <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>way</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="way" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> only to the greater <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>distress</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.96" formerWord="distress" newWord="friend" score="0.96">friend</span> of Mr. Bingley's continued <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>absence</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.86" formerWord="absence" newWord="minute" score="0.86">minute</span>. 
<p>Neither Jane nor Elizabeth were comfortable on this <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>subject</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="subject" newWord="friend" score="0.979">friend</span>. Day after <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>day</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="day" newWord="family" score="0.994">family</span> passed away without bringing any other tidings of him than the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>report</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.554" formerWord="report" newWord="intimacy" score="0.554">intimacy</span> which shortly prevailed in Meryton of his coming no more to Netherfield the whole <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>winter</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.483" formerWord="winter" newWord="mind" score="0.483">mind</span>; a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>report</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.554" formerWord="report" newWord="intimacy" score="0.554">intimacy</span> which highly incensed Mrs. Bennet, and which she never failed to contradict as a most scandalous <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>falsehood</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.244" formerWord="falsehood" newWord="hyacinth" score="0.244">hyacinth</span>. 
<p>Even Elizabeth began to fear - - not that Bingley was indifferent - - but that his sisters would be successful in keeping him away. Unwilling as she was to admit an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>idea</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.988" formerWord="idea" newWord="time" score="0.988">time</span> so destructive of Jane's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>happiness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="happiness" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span>, and so dishonorable to the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>stability</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.261" formerWord="stability" newWord="ankle" score="0.261">ankle</span> of her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>lover</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.676" formerWord="lover" newWord="return" score="0.676">return</span>, she could not prevent its frequently occurring. The united efforts of his two unfeeling sisters and of his overpowering <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>friend</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="friend" newWord="brother" score="0.994">brother</span>, assisted by the attractions of Miss Darcy and the amusements of London might be too much, she feared, for the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>strength</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.924" formerWord="strength" newWord="happiness" score="0.924">happiness</span> of his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>attachment</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.684" formerWord="attachment" newWord="deal" score="0.684">deal</span>. 
<p>As for Jane, her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>anxiety</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.898" formerWord="anxiety" newWord="life" score="0.898">life</span> under this <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>suspense</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.572" formerWord="suspense" newWord="selfishness" score="0.572">selfishness</span> was, of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>course</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.993" formerWord="course" newWord="brother" score="0.993">brother</span>, more painful than Elizabeth ' s, but whatever she felt she was desirous of concealing, and between herself and Elizabeth, therefore, the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>subject</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="subject" newWord="friend" score="0.979">friend</span> was never alluded to. But as no such <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>delicacy</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.4" formerWord="delicacy" newWord="something" score="0.4">something</span> restrained her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>mother</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="mother" newWord="sister" score="0.989">sister</span>, an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>hour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.679" formerWord="hour" newWord="mile" score="0.679">mile</span> seldom passed in which she did not <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>talk</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.933" formerWord="talk" newWord="happiness" score="0.933">happiness</span> of Bingley, express her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>impatience</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.448" formerWord="impatience" newWord="felicity" score="0.448">felicity</span> for his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>arrival</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="arrival" newWord="family" score="0.989">family</span>, or even require Jane to confess that if he did not come back she would think herself very ill used. It needed all Jane's steady <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>mildness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.223" formerWord="mildness" newWord="mouth" score="0.223">mouth</span> to bear these attacks with tolerable <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>tranquillity</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.408" formerWord="tranquillity" newWord="melancholy" score="0.408">melancholy</span>. 
<p>Mr. Collins returned most punctually on Monday <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fortnight</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.96" formerWord="fortnight" newWord="affection" score="0.96">affection</span>, but his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>reception</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.346" formerWord="reception" newWord="plain" score="0.346">plain</span> at <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>Longbourn</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.971" formerWord="Longbourn" newWord="family" score="0.971">Family</span> was not quite so gracious as it had been on his first <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>introduction</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.514" formerWord="introduction" newWord="note" score="0.514">note</span>. He was too happy, however, to need much <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>attention</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.951" formerWord="attention" newWord="brother" score="0.951">brother</span>; and luckily for the others, the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>business</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.981" formerWord="business" newWord="time" score="0.981">time</span> of love-making relieved them from a great <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>deal</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="deal" newWord="brother" score="0.989">brother</span> of his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>company</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.987" formerWord="company" newWord="brother" score="0.987">brother</span>. The <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>chief</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.922" formerWord="chief" newWord="day" score="0.922">day</span> of every <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>day</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="day" newWord="family" score="0.994">family</span> was spent by him at Lucas Lodge, and he sometimes returned to Longbourn only in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>time</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="time" newWord="family" score="0.995">family</span> to make an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>apology</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.793" formerWord="apology" newWord="character" score="0.793">character</span> for his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>absence</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.86" formerWord="absence" newWord="minute" score="0.86">minute</span> before the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>family</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="family" newWord="brother" score="0.996">brother</span> went to <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>bed</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.249" formerWord="bed" newWord="whip" score="0.249">whip</span>. 
<p>Mrs. Bennet was really in a most pitiable <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>state</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.972" formerWord="state" newWord="friend" score="0.972">friend</span>. The very mention of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>anything</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="anything" newWord="time" score="0.989">time</span> concerning the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>match</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.653" formerWord="match" newWord="period" score="0.653">period</span> threw her into an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>agony</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.599" formerWord="agony" newWord="minute" score="0.599">minute</span> of ill-humour, and wherever she went she was sure of hearing it talked of. The <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sight</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.308" formerWord="sight" newWord="pleasanter" score="0.308">pleasanter</span> of Miss Lucas was odious to her. As her successor in that <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>house</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="house" newWord="brother" score="0.989">brother</span>, she regarded her with jealous <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>abhorrence</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.454" formerWord="abhorrence" newWord="dirt" score="0.454">dirt</span>. Whenever Charlotte came to see them, she concluded her to be anticipating the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>hour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.679" formerWord="hour" newWord="mile" score="0.679">mile</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>possession</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.275" formerWord="possession" newWord="retirement" score="0.275">retirement</span>; and whenever she spoke in a low <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>voice</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="voice" newWord="brother" score="0.984">brother</span> to Mr. Collins, was convinced that they were talking of the Longbourn <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>estate</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.87" formerWord="estate" newWord="woman" score="0.87">woman</span>, and resolving to turn herself and her daughters out of the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>house</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="house" newWord="brother" score="0.989">brother</span>, as soon as Mr. Bennet were dead. She complained bitterly of all this to her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>husband</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="husband" newWord="brother" score="0.979">brother</span>. 
<p>"Indeed, Mr. Bennet,"said she,"it is very hard to think that Charlotte Lucas should ever be <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>mistress</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.807" formerWord="mistress" newWord="woman" score="0.807">woman</span> of this <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>house</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="house" newWord="brother" score="0.989">brother</span>, that I should be forced to make <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>way</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="way" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> for her, and live to see her take her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>place</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="place" newWord="family" score="0.99">family</span> in it!"
<p>"My dear, do not give <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>way</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="way" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> to such gloomy thoughts. Let us hope for better things. Let us flatter ourselves that I may be the survivor."
<p>This was not very consoling to Mrs. Bennet, and therefore, instead of making any <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>answer</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.987" formerWord="answer" newWord="brother" score="0.987">brother</span>, she went on as before. 
<p>"I cannot bear to think that they should have all this <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>estate</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.87" formerWord="estate" newWord="woman" score="0.87">woman</span>. If it was not for the entail, I should not mind it."
<p>"What should not you mind?"
<p>"I should not mind <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>anything</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="anything" newWord="time" score="0.989">time</span> at all."
<p>"Let us be thankful that you are preserved from a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>state</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.972" formerWord="state" newWord="friend" score="0.972">friend</span> of such <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>insensibility</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.403" formerWord="insensibility" newWord="danger" score="0.403">danger</span>."
<p>"I never can be thankful, Mr. Bennet, for <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>anything</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="anything" newWord="time" score="0.989">time</span> about the entail. How <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>anyone</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.361" formerWord="anyone" newWord="minute" score="0.361">minute</span> could have the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>conscience</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.947" formerWord="conscience" newWord="happiness" score="0.947">happiness</span> to entail away an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>estate</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.87" formerWord="estate" newWord="woman" score="0.87">woman</span> from one's own daughters, I cannot understand; and all for the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sake</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.756" formerWord="sake" newWord="company" score="0.756">company</span> of Mr. Collins too! Why should he have it more than <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>anybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.969" formerWord="anybody" newWord="way" score="0.969">way</span> else?"
<p>"I leave it to yourself to determine,"said Mr. Bennet. 
<p>
<p>
<p>Chapter 24 
<p>
<p>Miss Bingley's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>letter</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="letter" newWord="brother" score="0.991">brother</span> arrived, and put an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>end</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="end" newWord="time" score="0.984">time</span> to doubt. The very first <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sentence</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.756" formerWord="sentence" newWord="end" score="0.756">end</span> conveyed the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>assurance</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.882" formerWord="assurance" newWord="heart" score="0.882">heart</span> of their being all settled in London for the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>winter</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.483" formerWord="winter" newWord="mind" score="0.483">mind</span>, and concluded with her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>brother</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="brother" newWord="family" score="0.996">family</span>'s <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>regret</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.972" formerWord="regret" newWord="family" score="0.972">family</span> at not having had <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>time</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="time" newWord="family" score="0.995">family</span> to pay his respects to his friends in Hertfordshire before he left the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>country</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.987" formerWord="country" newWord="family" score="0.987">family</span>. 
<p>Hope was over, entirely over; and when Jane could attend to the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>rest</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="rest" newWord="nothing" score="0.984">nothing</span> of the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>letter</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="letter" newWord="brother" score="0.991">brother</span>, she found little, except the professed <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>affection</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="affection" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span> of the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>writer</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.421" formerWord="writer" newWord="conquest" score="0.421">conquest</span>, that could give her any <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>comfort</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.892" formerWord="comfort" newWord="day" score="0.892">day</span>. Miss Darcy's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>praise</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.948" formerWord="praise" newWord="time" score="0.948">time</span> occupied the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>chief</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.922" formerWord="chief" newWord="day" score="0.922">day</span> of it. Her many attractions were again dwelt on, and Caroline boasted joyfully of their increasing <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>intimacy</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.911" formerWord="intimacy" newWord="time" score="0.911">time</span>, and ventured to predict the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>accomplishment</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.366" formerWord="accomplishment" newWord="extreme" score="0.366">extreme</span> of the wishes which had been unfolded in her former <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>letter</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="letter" newWord="brother" score="0.991">brother</span>. She wrote also with great <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pleasure</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="pleasure" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> of her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>brother</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="brother" newWord="family" score="0.996">family</span>'s being an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>inmate</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.389" formerWord="inmate" newWord="relationship" score="0.389">relationship</span> of Mr. Darcy's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>house</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="house" newWord="brother" score="0.989">brother</span>, and mentioned with raptures some plans of the latter with <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>regard</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.953" formerWord="regard" newWord="family" score="0.953">family</span> to new <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>furniture</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.841" formerWord="furniture" newWord="minute" score="0.841">minute</span>. 
<p>Elizabeth, to whom Jane very soon communicated the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>chief</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.922" formerWord="chief" newWord="day" score="0.922">day</span> of all this, heard it in silent <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>indignation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.908" formerWord="indignation" newWord="anything" score="0.908">anything</span>. Her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>heart</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="heart" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> was divided between <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>concern</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.862" formerWord="concern" newWord="sister" score="0.862">sister</span> for her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span>, and <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>resentment</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.386" formerWord="resentment" newWord="papa" score="0.386">papa</span> against all others. To Caroline's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>assertion</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.636" formerWord="assertion" newWord="situation" score="0.636">situation</span> of her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>brother</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="brother" newWord="family" score="0.996">family</span>'s being partial to Miss Darcy she paid no <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>credit</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.817" formerWord="credit" newWord="love" score="0.817">love</span>. That he was really fond of Jane, she doubted no more than she had ever done; and much as she had always been disposed to like him, she could not think without <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>anger</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.957" formerWord="anger" newWord="friend" score="0.957">friend</span>, hardly without <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>contempt</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.724" formerWord="contempt" newWord="return" score="0.724">return</span>, on that <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>easiness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.344" formerWord="easiness" newWord="error" score="0.344">error</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>temper</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.897" formerWord="temper" newWord="woman" score="0.897">woman</span>, that want of proper <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>resolution</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.895" formerWord="resolution" newWord="life" score="0.895">life</span>, which now made him the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>slave</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.372" formerWord="slave" newWord="dining" score="0.372">dining</span> of his designing friends, and led him to sacrifice of his own <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>happiness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="happiness" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span> to the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>caprice</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.471" formerWord="caprice" newWord="minute" score="0.471">minute</span> of their <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>inclination</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.758" formerWord="inclination" newWord="mother" score="0.758">mother</span>. Had his own <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>happiness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="happiness" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span>, however, been the only <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sacrifice</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.232" formerWord="sacrifice" newWord="g" score="0.232">g</span>, he might have been allowed to <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sport</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.437" formerWord="sport" newWord="haste" score="0.437">haste</span> with it in whatever <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>manner</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.917" formerWord="manner" newWord="kind" score="0.917">kind</span> he thought best, but her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span>'s was involved in it, as she thought he must be sensible himself. It was a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>subject</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="subject" newWord="friend" score="0.979">friend</span>, in short, on which <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>reflection</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.253" formerWord="reflection" newWord="billiard-room" score="0.253">billiard-room</span> would be long indulged, and must be unavailing. She could think of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nothing</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="nothing" newWord="course" score="0.991">course</span> else; and yet whether Bingley's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>regard</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.953" formerWord="regard" newWord="family" score="0.953">family</span> had really died away, or were suppressed by his friends ' <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>interference</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.789" formerWord="interference" newWord="man" score="0.789">man</span>; whether he had been aware of Jane's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>attachment</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.684" formerWord="attachment" newWord="deal" score="0.684">deal</span>, or whether it had escaped his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>observation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.85" formerWord="observation" newWord="minute" score="0.85">minute</span>; whatever were the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>case</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.944" formerWord="case" newWord="brother" score="0.944">brother</span>, though her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>opinion</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.977" formerWord="opinion" newWord="nothing" score="0.977">nothing</span> of him must be materially affected by the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>difference</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.976" formerWord="difference" newWord="brother" score="0.976">brother</span>, her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span>'s <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>situation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.988" formerWord="situation" newWord="family" score="0.988">family</span> remained the same, her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>peace</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.817" formerWord="peace" newWord="anything" score="0.817">anything</span> equally wounded. 
<p>A <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>day</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="day" newWord="family" score="0.994">family</span> or two passed before Jane had <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>courage</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.55" formerWord="courage" newWord="thought" score="0.55">thought</span> to speak of her feelings to Elizabeth; but at last, on Mrs. Bennet's leaving them together, after a longer <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>irritation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.593" formerWord="irritation" newWord="respect" score="0.593">respect</span> than usual about Netherfield and its <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>master</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.818" formerWord="master" newWord="town" score="0.818">town</span>, she could not help saying: 
<p>"Oh, that my dear <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>mother</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="mother" newWord="sister" score="0.989">sister</span> had more <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>command</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.81" formerWord="command" newWord="thing" score="0.81">thing</span> over herself! She can have no <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>idea</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.988" formerWord="idea" newWord="time" score="0.988">time</span> of the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pain</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.981" formerWord="pain" newWord="time" score="0.981">time</span> she gives me by her continual reflections on him. But I will not repine. It cannot last long. He will be forgot, and we shall all be as we were before."
<p>Elizabeth looked at her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span> with incredulous <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>solicitude</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.615" formerWord="solicitude" newWord="minute" score="0.615">minute</span>, but said <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nothing</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="nothing" newWord="course" score="0.991">course</span>. 
<p>"You doubt me,"cried Jane, slightly colouring;"indeed, you have no <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>reason</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.676" formerWord="reason" newWord="world" score="0.676">world</span>. He may live in my <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>memory</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.462" formerWord="memory" newWord="deficiency" score="0.462">deficiency</span> as the most amiable <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>man</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="man" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span> of my <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>acquaintance</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.974" formerWord="acquaintance" newWord="time" score="0.974">time</span>, but that is all. I have <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nothing</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="nothing" newWord="course" score="0.991">course</span> either to hope or <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fear</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.831" formerWord="fear" newWord="family" score="0.831">family</span>, and <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nothing</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="nothing" newWord="course" score="0.991">course</span> to <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>reproach</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.255" formerWord="reproach" newWord="face" score="0.255">face</span> him with. Thank God! I have not that <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pain</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.981" formerWord="pain" newWord="time" score="0.981">time</span>. A little <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>time</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="time" newWord="family" score="0.995">family</span>, therefore - - I shall certainly try to get the better."
<p>With a stronger <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>voice</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="voice" newWord="brother" score="0.984">brother</span> she soon added,"I have this <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>comfort</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.892" formerWord="comfort" newWord="day" score="0.892">day</span> immediately, that it has not been more than an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>error</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.732" formerWord="error" newWord="minute" score="0.732">minute</span> of fancy on my <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>side</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.959" formerWord="side" newWord="nothing" score="0.959">nothing</span>, and that it has done no <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>harm</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.674" formerWord="harm" newWord="night" score="0.674">night</span> to <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>anyone</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.361" formerWord="anyone" newWord="minute" score="0.361">minute</span> but myself."
<p>"My dear Jane!"exclaimed Elizabeth,"you are too good. Your <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sweetness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.803" formerWord="sweetness" newWord="minute" score="0.803">minute</span> and <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>disinterestedness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.307" formerWord="disinterestedness" newWord="shoulder" score="0.307">shoulder</span> are really angelic; I do not know what to say to you. I feel as if I had never done you <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>justice</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.959" formerWord="justice" newWord="family" score="0.959">family</span>, or loved you as you deserve."
<p>Miss Bennet eagerly disclaimed all extraordinary <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>merit</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.205" formerWord="merit" newWord="attitude" score="0.205">attitude</span>, and threw back the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>praise</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.948" formerWord="praise" newWord="time" score="0.948">time</span> on her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span>'s warm <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>affection</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="affection" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span>. 
<p>"Nay,"said Elizabeth,"this is not fair. You wish to think all the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>world</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.982" formerWord="world" newWord="man" score="0.982">man</span> respectable, and are hurt if I speak <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>ill</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.95" formerWord="ill" newWord="son" score="0.95">son</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>anybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.969" formerWord="anybody" newWord="way" score="0.969">way</span>. I only want to think you perfect, and you set yourself against it. Do not be afraid of my running into any <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>excess</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.704" formerWord="excess" newWord="interest" score="0.704">interest</span>, of my encroaching on your <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>privilege</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.711" formerWord="privilege" newWord="woman" score="0.711">woman</span> of universal <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>good-will</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.242" formerWord="good-will" newWord="government" score="0.242">government</span>. You need not. There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>world</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.982" formerWord="world" newWord="man" score="0.982">man</span>, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>day</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="day" newWord="family" score="0.994">family</span> confirms my <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>belief</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.219" formerWord="belief" newWord="foresight" score="0.219">foresight</span> of the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>inconsistency</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.302" formerWord="inconsistency" newWord="dining" score="0.302">dining</span> of all human characters, and of the little <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>dependence</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.854" formerWord="dependence" newWord="conversation" score="0.854">conversation</span> that can be placed on the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>appearance</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.983" formerWord="appearance" newWord="family" score="0.983">family</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>merit</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.205" formerWord="merit" newWord="attitude" score="0.205">attitude</span> or <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sense</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.978" formerWord="sense" newWord="man" score="0.978">man</span>. In every <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>view</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.375" formerWord="view" newWord="dirt" score="0.375">dirt</span> it is unaccountable!"
<p>"My dear Lizzy, do not give <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>way</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="way" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> to such feelings as these. <p>"To oblige you, I would try to believe almost <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>anything</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="anything" newWord="time" score="0.989">time</span>, but no <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>one</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.909" formerWord="one" newWord="rest" score="0.909">rest</span> else could be benefited by such a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>belief</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.219" formerWord="belief" newWord="foresight" score="0.219">foresight</span> as this; for were I persuaded that Charlotte had any <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>regard</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.953" formerWord="regard" newWord="family" score="0.953">family</span> for him, I should only think worse of her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>understanding</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.721" formerWord="understanding" newWord="dinner" score="0.721">dinner</span> than I now do of her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>heart</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="heart" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span>. <p>"I must think your <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>language</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.216" formerWord="language" newWord="fuss" score="0.216">fuss</span> too strong in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>speaking</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.974" formerWord="speaking" newWord="family" score="0.974">family</span> of both,"replied Jane;"and I hope you will be convinced of it by seeing them happy together. Women fancy <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>admiration</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.893" formerWord="admiration" newWord="nothing" score="0.893">nothing</span> means more than it does."
<p>"And men take care that they should."
<p>"If it is designedly done, they cannot be justified; but I have no <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>idea</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.988" formerWord="idea" newWord="time" score="0.988">time</span> of there being so much <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>design</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.429" formerWord="design" newWord="wife" score="0.429">wife</span> in the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>world</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.982" formerWord="world" newWord="man" score="0.982">man</span> as some persons imagine."
<p>"I am far from attributing any <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>part</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="part" newWord="family" score="0.989">family</span> of Mr. Bingley's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>conduct</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.943" formerWord="conduct" newWord="kind" score="0.943">kind</span> to <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>design</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.429" formerWord="design" newWord="wife" score="0.429">wife</span>,"said Elizabeth;"but without scheming to do wrong, or to make others unhappy, there may be <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>error</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.732" formerWord="error" newWord="minute" score="0.732">minute</span>, and there may be <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>misery</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.917" formerWord="misery" newWord="time" score="0.917">time</span>. <p>"And do you impute it to either of those?"
<p>"<span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>Yes</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.883" formerWord="Yes" newWord="honour" score="0.883">Honour</span>; to the last. But if I go on, I shall displease you by saying what I think of persons you <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>esteem</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.718" formerWord="esteem" newWord="circumstance" score="0.718">circumstance</span>. Stop me whilst you can."
<p>"You persist, then, in supposing his sisters influence him?"
<p>"Yes, in conjunction with his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>friend</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="friend" newWord="brother" score="0.994">brother</span>."
<p>"I cannot believe it. Why should they try to influence him? They can only wish his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>happiness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="happiness" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span>; and if he is attached to me, no other <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>woman</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="woman" newWord="man" score="0.99">man</span> can secure it."
<p>"Your first <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>position</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.654" formerWord="position" newWord="chief" score="0.654">chief</span> is false. <p>"Beyond a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>doubt</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.985" formerWord="doubt" newWord="family" score="0.985">family</span>, they do wish him to choose Miss Darcy,"replied Jane;"but this may be from better feelings than you are supposing. They have known her much longer than they have known me; no <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>wonder</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.914" formerWord="wonder" newWord="heart" score="0.914">heart</span> if they love her better. What <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span> would think herself at <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>liberty</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.724" formerWord="liberty" newWord="part" score="0.724">part</span> to do it, unless there were <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>something</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.851" formerWord="something" newWord="mind" score="0.851">mind</span> very objectionable? By supposing such an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>affection</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="affection" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span>, you make <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>everybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.754" formerWord="everybody" newWord="word" score="0.754">word</span> acting unnaturally and wrong, and me most unhappy. Do not <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>distress</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.96" formerWord="distress" newWord="friend" score="0.96">friend</span> me by the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>idea</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.988" formerWord="idea" newWord="time" score="0.988">time</span>. I am not ashamed of having been mistaken - - or, at least, it is light, it is <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nothing</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="nothing" newWord="course" score="0.991">course</span> in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>comparison</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.542" formerWord="comparison" newWord="spirit" score="0.542">spirit</span> of what I should feel in thinking <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>ill</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.95" formerWord="ill" newWord="son" score="0.95">son</span> of him or his sisters. Let me take it in the best <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>light</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.302" formerWord="light" newWord="composure" score="0.302">composure</span>, in the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>light</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.302" formerWord="light" newWord="composure" score="0.302">composure</span> in which it may be understood."
<p>Elizabeth could not oppose such a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>wish</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="wish" newWord="brother" score="0.99">brother</span>; and from this <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>time</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="time" newWord="family" score="0.995">family</span> Mr. Bingley's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>name</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.971" formerWord="name" newWord="family" score="0.971">family</span> was scarcely ever mentioned between them. 
<p>Mrs. Bennet still continued to wonder and <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>repine</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.24" formerWord="repine" newWord="downstairs" score="0.24">downstairs</span> at his returning no more, and though a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>day</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="day" newWord="family" score="0.994">family</span> seldom passed in which Elizabeth did not <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>account</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="account" newWord="family" score="0.991">family</span> for it clearly, there was little <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>chance</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.924" formerWord="chance" newWord="time" score="0.924">time</span> of her ever considering it with less <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>perplexity</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.545" formerWord="perplexity" newWord="delay" score="0.545">delay</span>. Her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>daughter</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.927" formerWord="daughter" newWord="nothing" score="0.927">nothing</span> endeavoured to convince her of what she did not believe herself, that his attentions to Jane had been merely the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>effect</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.961" formerWord="effect" newWord="sister" score="0.961">sister</span> of a common and transient <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>liking</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.858" formerWord="liking" newWord="deal" score="0.858">deal</span>, which ceased when he saw her no more; but though the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>probability</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.849" formerWord="probability" newWord="family" score="0.849">family</span> of the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>statement</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.511" formerWord="statement" newWord="engagement" score="0.511">engagement</span> was admitted at the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>time</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="time" newWord="family" score="0.995">family</span>, she had the same <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>story</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.837" formerWord="story" newWord="letter" score="0.837">letter</span> to repeat every <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>day</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="day" newWord="family" score="0.994">family</span>. Mrs. Bennet's best <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>comfort</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.892" formerWord="comfort" newWord="day" score="0.892">day</span> was that Mr. Bingley must be down again in the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>summer</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.27" formerWord="summer" newWord="exposure" score="0.27">exposure</span>. 
<p>Mr. Bennet treated the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>matter</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.969" formerWord="matter" newWord="affection" score="0.969">affection</span> differently."So, Lizzy,"said he one <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>day</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="day" newWord="family" score="0.994">family</span>,"your <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span> is crossed in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>love</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="love" newWord="man" score="0.984">man</span>, I find. I congratulate her. Next to being married, a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>girl</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.988" formerWord="girl" newWord="man" score="0.988">man</span> likes to be crossed a little in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>love</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="love" newWord="man" score="0.984">man</span> now and then. It is <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>something</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.851" formerWord="something" newWord="mind" score="0.851">mind</span> to think of, and it gives her a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sort</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.976" formerWord="sort" newWord="man" score="0.976">man</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>distinction</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.533" formerWord="distinction" newWord="weather" score="0.533">weather</span> among her companions. When is your <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>turn</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.281" formerWord="turn" newWord="control" score="0.281">control</span> to come? You will hardly bear to be long outdone by Jane. Now is your <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>time</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="time" newWord="family" score="0.995">family</span>. Here are officers enough in Meryton to disappoint all the young ladies in the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>country</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.987" formerWord="country" newWord="family" score="0.987">family</span>. Let Wickham be your <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>man</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="man" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span>. He is a pleasant <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fellow</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.784" formerWord="fellow" newWord="happiness" score="0.784">happiness</span>, and would jilt you creditably."
<p>"Thank you, <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sir</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.966" formerWord="sir" newWord="brother" score="0.966">brother</span>, but a less agreeable <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>man</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="man" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span> would satisfy me. We must not all expect Jane's good <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fortune</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.975" formerWord="fortune" newWord="man" score="0.975">man</span>."
<p>"True,"said Mr. Bennet,"but it is a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>comfort</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.892" formerWord="comfort" newWord="day" score="0.892">day</span> to think that whatever of that <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>kind</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="kind" newWord="nothing" score="0.99">nothing</span> may befall you, you have an affectionate <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>mother</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="mother" newWord="sister" score="0.989">sister</span> who will make the most of it."
<p>Mr. Wickham's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>society</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="society" newWord="time" score="0.979">time</span> was of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>material</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.253" formerWord="material" newWord="landing-place" score="0.253">landing-place</span> <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>service</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.851" formerWord="service" newWord="time" score="0.851">time</span> in dispelling the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>gloom</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.4" formerWord="gloom" newWord="smile" score="0.4">smile</span> which the late perverse occurrences had thrown on many of the Longbourn <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>family</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="family" newWord="brother" score="0.996">brother</span>. They saw him often, and to his other recommendations was now added that of general <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>unreserve</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.338" formerWord="unreserve" newWord="warmth" score="0.338">warmth</span>. The <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>whole</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.974" formerWord="whole" newWord="family" score="0.974">family</span> of what Elizabeth had already heard, his claims on Mr. Darcy, and all that he had suffered from him, was now openly acknowledged and publicly canvassed; and <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>everybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.754" formerWord="everybody" newWord="word" score="0.754">word</span> was pleased to know how much they had always disliked Mr. Darcy before they had known <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>anything</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="anything" newWord="time" score="0.989">time</span> of the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>matter</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.969" formerWord="matter" newWord="affection" score="0.969">affection</span>. 
<p>Miss Bennet was the only <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>creature</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.777" formerWord="creature" newWord="woman" score="0.777">woman</span> who could suppose there might be any extenuating circumstances in the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>case</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.944" formerWord="case" newWord="brother" score="0.944">brother</span>, <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>unknown</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.522" formerWord="unknown" newWord="park" score="0.522">park</span> to the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>society</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="society" newWord="time" score="0.979">time</span> of Hertfordshire; her mild and steady <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>candour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.198" formerWord="candour" newWord="talker" score="0.198">talker</span> always pleaded for allowances, and urged the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>possibility</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.623" formerWord="possibility" newWord="ease" score="0.623">ease</span> of mistakes - - but by <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>everybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.754" formerWord="everybody" newWord="word" score="0.754">word</span> else Mr. Darcy was condemned as the worst of men. 
<p>
<p>
<p>Chapter 25 
<p>
<p>After a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>week</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.988" formerWord="week" newWord="brother" score="0.988">brother</span> spent in professions of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>love</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="love" newWord="man" score="0.984">man</span> and schemes of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>felicity</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.883" formerWord="felicity" newWord="brother" score="0.883">brother</span>, Mr. Collins was called from his amiable Charlotte by the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>arrival</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="arrival" newWord="family" score="0.989">family</span> of Saturday. The <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pain</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.981" formerWord="pain" newWord="time" score="0.981">time</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>separation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.866" formerWord="separation" newWord="company" score="0.866">company</span>, however, might be alleviated on his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>side</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.959" formerWord="side" newWord="nothing" score="0.959">nothing</span>, by preparations for the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>reception</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.346" formerWord="reception" newWord="plain" score="0.346">plain</span> of his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>bride</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.72" formerWord="bride" newWord="mother" score="0.72">mother</span>; as he had <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>reason</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.676" formerWord="reason" newWord="world" score="0.676">world</span> to hope, that shortly after his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>return</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="return" newWord="brother" score="0.979">brother</span> into Hertfordshire, the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>day</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.994" formerWord="day" newWord="family" score="0.994">family</span> would be fixed that was to make him the happiest of men. He took <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>leave</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.931" formerWord="leave" newWord="friend" score="0.931">friend</span> of his relations at <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>Longbourn</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.971" formerWord="Longbourn" newWord="family" score="0.971">Family</span> with as much <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>solemnity</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.776" formerWord="solemnity" newWord="return" score="0.776">return</span> as before; wished his fair cousins <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>health</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.937" formerWord="health" newWord="pleasure" score="0.937">pleasure</span> and <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>happiness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="happiness" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span> again, and promised their <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>father</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.95" formerWord="father" newWord="aunt" score="0.95">aunt</span> another <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>letter</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="letter" newWord="brother" score="0.991">brother</span> of thanks. 
<p>On the following Monday, Mrs. Bennet had the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>pleasure</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="pleasure" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span> of receiving her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>brother</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="brother" newWord="family" score="0.996">family</span> and his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>wife</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.933" formerWord="wife" newWord="man" score="0.933">man</span>, who came as usual to spend the Christmas at Longbourn. Mr. Gardiner was a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sensible</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.798" formerWord="sensible" newWord="conversation" score="0.798">conversation</span>, gentlemanlike <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>man</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="man" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span>, greatly superior to his <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span>, as well by <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nature</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.94" formerWord="nature" newWord="time" score="0.94">time</span> as <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>education</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.787" formerWord="education" newWord="hearing" score="0.787">hearing</span>. The Netherfield ladies would have had <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>difficulty</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.903" formerWord="difficulty" newWord="home" score="0.903">home</span> in believing that a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>man</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="man" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span> who lived by <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>trade</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.326" formerWord="trade" newWord="avoidance" score="0.326">avoidance</span>, and within <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>view</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.375" formerWord="view" newWord="dirt" score="0.375">dirt</span> of his own warehouses, could have been so well-bred and agreeable. Mrs. Gardiner, who was several years younger than Mrs. Bennet and Mrs. Phillips, was an amiable, intelligent, elegant <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>woman</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="woman" newWord="man" score="0.99">man</span>, and a great <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>favourite</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.321" formerWord="favourite" newWord="lasting" score="0.321">lasting</span> with all her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>Longbourn</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.971" formerWord="Longbourn" newWord="family" score="0.971">Family</span> nieces. Between the two eldest and herself especially, there subsisted a particular <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>regard</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.953" formerWord="regard" newWord="family" score="0.953">family</span>. They had frequently been staying with her in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>town</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="town" newWord="brother" score="0.991">brother</span>. 
<p>The first <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>part</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="part" newWord="family" score="0.989">family</span> of Mrs. Gardiner's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>business</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.981" formerWord="business" newWord="time" score="0.981">time</span> on her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>arrival</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="arrival" newWord="family" score="0.989">family</span> was to distribute her presents and describe the newest fashions. When this was done she had a less active <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>part</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.989" formerWord="part" newWord="family" score="0.989">family</span> to play. It became her turn to listen. Mrs. Bennet had many grievances to relate, and much to complain of. They had all been very ill-used since she last saw her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span>. Two of her girls had been upon the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>point</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.974" formerWord="point" newWord="brother" score="0.974">brother</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>marriage</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="marriage" newWord="brother" score="0.991">brother</span>, and after all there was <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>nothing</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="nothing" newWord="course" score="0.991">course</span> in it. 
<p>"I do not blame Jane,"she continued,"for Jane would have got Mr. Bingley if she could. But Lizzy! Oh, <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span>! It is very hard to think that she might have been Mr. Collins's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>wife</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.933" formerWord="wife" newWord="man" score="0.933">man</span> by this <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>time</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="time" newWord="family" score="0.995">family</span>, had it not been for her own <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>perverseness</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.477" formerWord="perverseness" newWord="look" score="0.477">look</span>. He made her an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>offer</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.771" formerWord="offer" newWord="attempt" score="0.771">attempt</span> in this very <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>room</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.972" formerWord="room" newWord="course" score="0.972">course</span>, and she refused him. The <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>consequence</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.902" formerWord="consequence" newWord="situation" score="0.902">situation</span> of it is, that Lady Lucas will have a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>daughter</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.927" formerWord="daughter" newWord="nothing" score="0.927">nothing</span> married before I have, and that the Longbourn <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>estate</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.87" formerWord="estate" newWord="woman" score="0.87">woman</span> is just as much entailed as ever. The Lucases are very artful people indeed, <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span>. They are all for what they can get. I am sorry to say it of them, but so it is. It makes me very nervous and poorly, to be thwarted so in my own <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>family</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.996" formerWord="family" newWord="brother" score="0.996">brother</span>, and to have neighbours who think of themselves before <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>anybody</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.969" formerWord="anybody" newWord="way" score="0.969">way</span> else. However, your coming just at this <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>time</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="time" newWord="family" score="0.995">family</span> is the greatest of comforts, and I am very glad to hear what you tell us, of long sleeves."
<p>Mrs. Gardiner, to whom the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>chief</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.922" formerWord="chief" newWord="day" score="0.922">day</span> of this <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>news</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.977" formerWord="news" newWord="brother" score="0.977">brother</span> had been given before, in the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>course</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.993" formerWord="course" newWord="brother" score="0.993">brother</span> of Jane and Elizabeth's <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>correspondence</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.246" formerWord="correspondence" newWord="entree" score="0.246">entree</span> with her, made her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sister</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="sister" newWord="brother" score="0.995">brother</span> a slight <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>answer</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.987" formerWord="answer" newWord="brother" score="0.987">brother</span>, and, in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>compassion</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.961" formerWord="compassion" newWord="family" score="0.961">family</span> to her nieces, turned the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>conversation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.981" formerWord="conversation" newWord="friend" score="0.981">friend</span>. 
<p>When alone with Elizabeth afterwards, she spoke more on the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>subject</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.979" formerWord="subject" newWord="friend" score="0.979">friend</span>."It seems likely to have been a desirable <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>match</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.653" formerWord="match" newWord="period" score="0.653">period</span> for Jane,"said she."I am sorry it went off. But these things happen so often! A young <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>man</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="man" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span>, such as you describe Mr. Bingley, so easily falls in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>love</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="love" newWord="man" score="0.984">man</span> with a pretty <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>girl</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.988" formerWord="girl" newWord="man" score="0.988">man</span> for a few weeks, and when <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>accident</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.679" formerWord="accident" newWord="point" score="0.679">point</span> separates them, so easily forgets her, that these <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>sort</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.976" formerWord="sort" newWord="man" score="0.976">man</span> of inconsistencies are very frequent."
<p>"An excellent <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>consolation</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.853" formerWord="consolation" newWord="money" score="0.853">money</span> in its <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>way</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.991" formerWord="way" newWord="friend" score="0.991">friend</span>,"said Elizabeth,"but it will not do for us. We do not suffer by <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>accident</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.679" formerWord="accident" newWord="point" score="0.679">point</span>. It does not often happen that the <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>interference</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.789" formerWord="interference" newWord="man" score="0.789">man</span> of friends will persuade a young <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>man</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.992" formerWord="man" newWord="brother" score="0.992">brother</span> of independent <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>fortune</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.975" formerWord="fortune" newWord="man" score="0.975">man</span> to think no more of a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>girl</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.988" formerWord="girl" newWord="man" score="0.988">man</span> whom he was violently in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>love</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="love" newWord="man" score="0.984">man</span> with only a few days before."
<p>"But that <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>expression</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.794" formerWord="expression" newWord="woman" score="0.794">woman</span> of ' violently in <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>love</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="love" newWord="man" score="0.984">man</span> ' is so hackneyed, so doubtful, so indefinite, that it gives me very little <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>idea</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.988" formerWord="idea" newWord="time" score="0.988">time</span>. It is as often applied to feelings which arise from a <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>half-hour</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.532" formerWord="half-hour" newWord="partner" score="0.532">partner</span>'s <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>acquaintance</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.974" formerWord="acquaintance" newWord="time" score="0.974">time</span>, as to a real, strong <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>attachment</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.684" formerWord="attachment" newWord="deal" score="0.684">deal</span>. Pray, how violent was Mr. Bingley's love?"
<p>"I never saw a more promising <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>inclination</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.758" formerWord="inclination" newWord="mother" score="0.758">mother</span>; he was growing quite inattentive to other people, and wholly engrossed by her. Every <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>time</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.995" formerWord="time" newWord="family" score="0.995">family</span> they met, it was more decided and remarkable. At his own <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>ball</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.985" formerWord="ball" newWord="friend" score="0.985">friend</span> he offended two or three young ladies, by not asking them to <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>dance</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.902" formerWord="dance" newWord="answer" score="0.902">answer</span>; and I spoke to him twice myself, without receiving an <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>answer</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.987" formerWord="answer" newWord="brother" score="0.987">brother</span>. Could there be finer symptoms? Is not general <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>incivility</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.276" formerWord="incivility" newWord="feebleness" score="0.276">feebleness</span> the very essence of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>love</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="love" newWord="man" score="0.984">man</span>?"
<p>"Oh, yes! - - of that <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>kind</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.99" formerWord="kind" newWord="nothing" score="0.99">nothing</span> of <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>love</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.984" formerWord="love" newWord="man" score="0.984">man</span> which I suppose him to have felt. Poor Jane! I am sorry for her, because, with her <span class="color" title="Was: <span class='purple'>disposition</span> / Word2Vec similarity: 0.799" formerWord="disposition" newWord="minute" score="0.799">minute</span>, she may not get over it immediately. It had better have happened to you, Lizzy; you would have laughed yourself out of it sooner. But do you think she would be prevailed upon to go back with us?
